name: Bee Garden

images.description: Entrance of the café with a little terrace in front
Cozy window table in the first floor
Second floor workspace with plenty of seating
Another bar room in the second floor
View of the big terrace they have in the back

review:
The space is huge — it has two floors, and a third one was under renovation when I visited.There’s also a spacious terrace.
Besides having lots of space, I also loved their menu: they focus on healthier options and use homemade products like butter, jam, and granola.
You’ll find breakfast and brunch menus, as well as lunch dishes like bagels, toasts, and burgers.
A personal highlight: two little tables by the window. I sat there working while watching the rain outside — the perfect cozy spot.
They’re very laptop-friendly — in fact, they mentioned the second floor is often seen as their co-working area.

name: Pátio Bonjardim

images.description: View of the store and the entrance to the cafe
Entrance to the first floor of the cafe
The cozy cafe counter with vintage decor and beautiful portuguese tiles
The spacious garden in the back that makes forget you are in the city

review:
It feels like a hidden gem — literally.
To enter, you pass through a shop filled with knobs and home furniture — lots of charming pieces.
At the back, you’ll find a café with a big, lovely garden where birds sing and you almost forget you’re in the city center.
Just note it gets quite full during lunchtime.

name: Yanetta

images.description: The cafe counter with plenty of cake options.
Plenty of books and magazines you can pick from.
My work setup at one of the window tables, accompanied by a cappuccino and a bit of sunshine.
The view to the terrace from my window table.

review:
This Ukrainian café offers a brunch-focused menu, many sandwiches, cakes, and some traditional Ukrainian sweets and dishes.
There's a small terrace in front with three tables, perfect for a sunny day.
The interior is not very big either but it is cozy and there are two window tables which are always my go-to spot when I’m alone.

name: Mel Living Nordic Shop & Café
review:
A very inspiring café rooted in the Nordic lifestyle.
It also functions as a shop, filled with Scandinavian-inspired items—from hand creams and candles to ceramics and books.
The menu is simple, focused on coffee (a bit more on the pricier side compared to other spots), and you can also enjoy some Nordic pastries.
For now, it's definitely a unique concept in Porto.
I enjoyed my time there — it was quiet, and the internet was very good.
